meanings.definition: The evening or day before a certain event.
meanings.sent1: On the eve of her birthday, she was excited to celebrate.
meanings.sent2: We always have a big dinner on Christmas Eve.
meanings.sent3: The eve of the party was filled with anticipation and joy.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set on the eve of the wedding, the sky turned a beautiful shade of pink.
meanings.sent5: The eve of the concert felt magical, like anything was possible.

meanings.definition: The period just before an important event.
meanings.sent1: The eve of the exam was a time of intense studying.
meanings.sent2: The eve of the competition was nerve-wracking for the athletes.
meanings.sent3: On the eve of the race, the runners were full of energy and excitement.
meanings.sent4: As the eve of the performance approached, the actors rehearsed tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The eve of the presentation was a mix of anxiety and anticipation.

meanings.definition: To come or be before in time.
meanings.sent1: I will eve the arrival of the guests by preparing the food early.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to eve the deadline by finishing her work ahead of time.
meanings.sent3: He decided to eve the meeting by arriving fifteen minutes early.
meanings.sent4: The birds' chirping seemed to eve the sunrise every morning.
meanings.sent5: The flowers blooming eve the arrival of spring in the garden.
